reviews.review_summary: The user is overall pleased and impressed with the ROG Ally after 15-20 hours of use. They highlight its performance, aesthetics, malleability, value, and QoL/accessibility.
pros: Good performance in high fidelity games
Comfortable to use for extended periods
3 months of Xbox Game Pass Ultimate included
cons: Battery life varies and can be short in high performance modes
Fans are audible in higher power modes

reviews.review_summary: Compared to the Steam Deck, the ROG Ally shines in screen quality, ability to play PC Game Pass, and ease of playing games from other stores. However, it has better performance when plugged in or in Turbo mode, and the setup process is cumbersome.
pros: Better screen quality than Steam Deck
Ability to play PC Game Pass
Ease of playing games from other stores
cons: Better performance when plugged in or in Turbo mode
Battery life is better on Steam Deck

reviews.review_summary: The user wants an Ally for its ability to play Game Pass and other non-Steam games, but notes that the software is currently rough and there are minor fit and finish issues.
pros: Ability to play Game Pass and other non-Steam games

reviews.review_summary: The user is tempted to buy the ROG Ally with its dock to use it as an office desktop due to its high performance and low power cores.
The user expresses concerns about the quality control of the Asus ROG Strix line, suggesting that it may be subpar and increase the risk of receiving a defective product.

The Asus ROG Phone 7 Ultimate is a top-tier gaming phone with impressive hardware specifications, including a Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 processor, 16GB RAM, and a 6,000mAh battery. It features a 165Hz AMOLED display, advanced cooling systems, and various gaming-centric features. However, its camera system is not world-class, which is acceptable for a gaming phone. The phone is designed for gamers, with features like air triggers, a split battery design, and compatibility with accessories like the AeroActive Cooler 7.

The Asus Rog Phone 8 Pro is a gaming phone with a more widespread appeal, featuring waterproofing, wireless charging, improved cameras, and a more traditional design. It has a 6.78-inch E6 OLED display with a 165Hz refresh rate, Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chipset, up to 24GB of RAM, and a 5500mAh battery. The phone also includes a triple camera setup with gimbal stabilization, a telephoto camera, and an ultra-wide camera.
cons: Smaller battery compared to previous models
Punch hole cutout on the display
Downgraded speakers and air trigger capacitive controls
Gets hot without the cooling fan
No built-in subwoofer in the cooler

reviews.review_summary: The design of the Asus Rog Phone 8 Pro is boring.
The Rog Phone 7 is still the best one.
The Rog Phone 8 Pro is a downgrade from the 7th. The punch camera is something I hate in modern phones. Other gaming phones have circumvented this issue by hiding the camera underneath the screen.

The reviewer is highly impressed with the new Asus ROG Zephyrus G14 and G16, praising their refined and elegant design, OLED displays, and performance. However, there are concerns about the lack of a print screen key, potential OLED burn-in, and the use of a proprietary adapter.
pros: OLED displays with fantastic colors and contrast
High performance with AMD and Intel chips
Good thermal performance and fan noise

reviews.review_summary: The reviewer is highly impressed with the new Asus ROG Zephyrus G14 and G16, praising their refined and elegant design, OLED displays, and performance. However, there are concerns about the lack of a print screen key, potential OLED burn-in, and the use of a proprietary adapter.
pros: OLED displays with fantastic colors and contrast
High performance with AMD and Intel chips
Good thermal performance and fan noise

reviews.review_summary: The commenter finds the speakers on the G16 to be okay but muffled, with muddy highs and decent bass. Performance on the 4090 model is lacking due to PCIe 8x Gen3.0 connection. The device gets very hot at the top of the keyboard. The screen is awesome but has color shift and green hue issues. The commenter returned two systems and prefers MacBook Pro for its build quality.
cons: Device gets very hot at the top of the keyboard
Color shift and green hue issues on the screen

reviews.review_summary: The commenter dislikes Asus products, stating that they tend to break after one year.
cons: Tends to break after one year

overall_decision: The Asus ROG Phone 7 Ultimate is a highly recommended product for gamers due to its high-performance hardware, advanced cooling systems, and gaming-centric features. While its camera system is not the best, it is sufficient for a gaming phone. The phone's design is thick and heavy, which may not appeal to everyone, but it is a trade-off for the impressive battery life and performance. Overall, if you are a gamer looking for a top-tier gaming phone, the Asus ROG Phone 7 Ultimate is a great choice.
